H0.text: What is the name of the steam locomotive which set the world speed record in July 1938 by reaching 126 mph on the East Coast Mainline  in England. Flying Scotsman

H1.text: What is the name of the steam locomotive which set the world speed record in July 1938 by reaching 126 mph on the East Coast Mainline  in England. Silver Link

H2.text: What is the name of the steam locomotive which set the world speed record in July 1938 by reaching 126 mph on the East Coast Mainline  in England. Dominion of Canada

H3.text: What is the name of the steam locomotive which set the world speed record in July 1938 by reaching 126 mph on the East Coast Mainline  in England. Mallard

A4.text: On 3 July 1938, Mallard claimed the world speed record for steam locomotives at 126 mph (203 km/h) during a trial of the new quick-acting Westinghouse QSA brake.

A5.text: Mallard broke the world speed record for steam locomotives at 126 mph (203 km/h), which still stands today.
